enb_long_title: Fifth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change
section_title: Annual Inventories of National GHG Data for 1996:
sentences: On Wednesday, 27 October, SBI considered the report on Annex I Parties' GHG inventory data for 1990-1997.
The US, with POLAND, stressed that timeliness and completeness of submissions were critical in providing a basis for COP action.
The EU noted that its future national systems would fulfill quality and time requirements, and expressed concern about the continuous increase in GHG emissions since 1990.
Chair Ashe said he would prepare draft conclusions for SBI's consideration.

On Monday, 1 November, SBI adopted Chair Ashe's draft conclusions on GHG inventory data for 1996 (FCCC/SBI/1999/L.9) that, inter alia: note further efforts are required to ensure adherence to the guidelines for preparation of national communications by Annex I Parties; and invite Parties experiencing difficulties with submitting GHG inventories in a timely manner to provide a submission to the Secretariat describing the nature of these difficulties.
